sentences.english: Note that different users of the system have different goals, and that these goals are often mutually exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 请注意系统的不同用户有不同的目标，而且这些目标经常是相互排斥的。

sentences.english: In this hectic and often confusing world in which we live, one of the most priceless treasures I possess is a happy and mutually sustaining marriage.
sentences.chinese: 在我们生活的这个纷繁复杂的世界里，我拥有的一个最有价值的珍宝就是我们这段幸福而相互扶持的婚姻。

sentences.english: Without honesty, your best efforts to resolve conflicts will be wasted because you will not understand each other well enough to find mutually acceptable solutions.
sentences.chinese: 没有诚实，就不能很充分很好地了解彼此以找到互相都能接受的解决方法也解决冲突的最大努力也将白费。

detailed_translations.english: two ideas or beliefs that are mutually exclusive cannot both exist or be true at the same time

name: nasty
trans: adj. 肮脏的、令人厌恶的、严重的

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: native
trans: adj. 天生的、天然的、本国的、本地的

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: a recurring nightmare
sentences.chinese: 一再出现的噩梦

detailed_translations.english: a very frightening dream

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

sentences.english: Emigration has notably increased over the past five years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去五年中，移居国外的人明显增加。

sentences.english: Notably absent from his statement was any hint of an apology.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里显然没有丝毫道歉的意思。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is clearly different, important, or unusual

name: noteworthy
trans: adj. 值得注意的、显著的

sentences.english: a noteworthy achievement
sentences.chinese: 显著的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的， 值得注目的
detailed_translations.english: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

sentences.english: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.english: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.chinese: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.english: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.chinese: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

detailed_translations.english: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

sentences.english: Copies of the lists were posted so that omissions could be corrected.
sentences.chinese: 多份名单被张贴出来，以便更正遗漏之处。

detailed_translations.english: when you do not include or do not do something

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

sentences.english: The new laws will be just as oppressive as those they replace.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将跟被它所取代的那些法律一样不公正。

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫的；沉重的；压制性的；难以忍受的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a society, its laws, or customs as oppressive, you think they treat people cruelly and unfairly

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
sentences.chinese: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀
detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

sentences.english: She outlived her husband by 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 她比她丈夫多活了20年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比…活得长；比…经久；经受住；渡过…而存在
detailed_translations.english: to remain alive after someone else has died

sentences.english: Every few months, I receive an e-mail from an outraged (usually white) reader who is dismayed by what she sees as the denigration of my work.
sentences.chinese: 每隔几个月，我便会收到一封来自愤怒读者（通常是白人）的电子邮件，对于她认为我的作品遭到的诋毁感到愤忾。

sentences.english: And outraged, nauseous, flabbergasted ... I wish I could say I can't imagine what they were thinking, but in fact I do have a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我感到受了伤害，并且愤怒、恶心、震惊······ 我但愿自己能说无法想像出他们的想法，但事实上我有一个猜想。

sentences.english: Greeks have turned out in droves to a series of nationwide protests against the economy and austerity measures, outraged that they are being asked to make more sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 希腊人举行了一系列针对经济状况和紧缩措施的大规模抗议，他们对政府要求自己做出更多牺牲感到愤怒。

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的、绝大部分的

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: parallel
trans: n. 平行线、类似的事情

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

sentences.english: paralysis of the lower body
sentences.chinese: 下半身瘫痪

sentences.english: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

sentences.english: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。

sentences.english: a very passionate young man
sentences.chinese: 一位感情热烈的年轻人

sentences.english: a passionate lover
sentences.chinese: 富有激情的爱人

sentences.english: a passionate kiss
sentences.chinese: 激情的一吻

detailed_translations.english: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

sentences.english: the maximum permissible level of radiation
sentences.chinese: 允许的最大辐射水平

detailed_translations.english: allowed by law or by the rules

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
sentences.chinese: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

sentences.english: He'd telephoned with some phony excuse she didn't believe for a minute.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些假的借口打电话，她根本就不信。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as phony, you disapprove of it because it is false rather than genuine

name: physical
trans: adj. 身体的、生理的、实体的

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

sentences.english: The issue has polarized the country.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题使整个国家变得两极化。

detailed_translations.english: to divide into clearly separate groups with opposite beliefs, ideas, or opinions, or to make people do this

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

sentences.english: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
sentences.chinese: 运送药品、食品等宝贵物资的飞机

sentences.english: our planet’s precious resources
sentences.chinese: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

detailed_translations.english: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
sentences.chinese: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

sentences.english: The prevailing mood of public opinion remained hostile.
sentences.chinese: 公众仍普遍持敌对情绪。

sentences.english: the prevailing economic conditions in Northern Ireland
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰普遍的经济状况

detailed_translations.english: existing or accepted in a particular place or at a particular time

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: primary
trans: adj. 主要的、基本的、初级的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: productive
trans: adj. 生产的、多产的、有效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

sentences.english: a proficient typist
sentences.chinese: 熟练的打字员

detailed_translations.english: able to do something well or skilfully

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

sentences.english: ...a prohibition on discrimination.
sentences.chinese: …一项对歧视的禁令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止；禁令；禁酒；诉讼中止令
detailed_translations.english: the act of saying that something is illegal

sentences.english: a prominent Russian scientist
sentences.chinese: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

sentences.english: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

sentences.english: a prominent nose
sentences.chinese: 高鼻子

detailed_translations.english: important

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

sentences.english: His eyes shifted to the prone body on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他的视线移向了趴在地上的尸体。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于…的， 很有可能…的； 俯卧的
detailed_translations.english: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful

sentences.english: a pronounced Polish accent
sentences.chinese: 明显的波兰口音

sentences.english: This disability is more pronounced in men.
sentences.chinese: 这种障碍在男性中表现得更为明显。

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的；断然的；讲出来的
detailed_translations.english: very great or noticeable

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something

sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.

sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

trans: adv. 鲁莽地、不计后果地

sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.

sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

sentences.english: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something becomes active or strong again

sentences.english: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

detailed_translations.english: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

sentences.english: a righteous God
sentences.chinese: 正义的上帝

detailed_translations.english: morally good and fair

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

sentences.english: Her hands were rough from hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。

sentences.english: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形

sentences.english: We were bumping over the rough ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

sentences.english: a rough translation
sentences.chinese: 粗略的翻译

detailed_translations.english: having an uneven surface

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

sentences.english: I don't think I deserve to be made the scapegoat for a couple of bad results.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我不该为出现的一些不良后果充当替罪羊。

sentences.english: ...a climate where ethnic minorities are continually scapegoated for the lack of jobs and housing problems.
sentences.chinese: …一种屡屡把缺少工作职位和住房问题归罪于少数族裔的风气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 替罪羊，替人顶罪者；替身
detailed_translations.english: someone who is blamed for something bad that happens, even if it is not their fault
To scapegoat someone means to blame them publicly for something bad that has happened, even though it was not their fault

sentences.english: a scary moment
sentences.chinese: 恐怖的一刻

sentences.english: a scary movie
sentences.chinese: 恐怖片

sentences.english: The book is both scary and funny.
sentences.chinese: 这本书既恐怖又有趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的， 骇人的； 惊慌的， 害怕的； 胆小的， 易受惊的
detailed_translations.english: frightening

sentences.english: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们对这个提议报以轻蔑的态度。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑， 鄙视； 拒绝， 不屑
detailed_translations.english: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: scrutinize
trans: v. 仔细察看、详细检查

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

sentences.english: There are no secure jobs these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。

sentences.english: We want a secure future for our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。

sentences.english: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: the spread of nationalist sentiments
sentences.chinese: 民族主义情绪的传播

sentences.english: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: severe
trans: adj. 严重的、严峻的、严厉的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

sentences.english: He clanged his sword three times on his shield.
sentences.chinese: 他用他的剑当当当地敲了3下盾。

sentences.english: He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手遮挡反射过来的阳光。

sentences.english: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他抬手遮住眼睛免受阳光照射。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

sentences.english: They saw the man with a little girl skipping along behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到那个男人身后跟着一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩。

detailed_translations.english: to go from one subject to another in no fixed order
a skipping movement

sentences.english: a slim young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材苗条的年轻女子

sentences.english: a slim waist
sentences.chinese: 纤腰

detailed_translations.chinese: 苗条的；修长的；微小的；差的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is slim is attractively thin
to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking a lot of exercise etc

detailed_translations.chinese: (Slim)人名；(阿拉伯)萨利姆；(英、西)斯利姆

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: spontaneity
trans: n. 自然流露、即兴发挥

sentences.english: He had the spontaneity of a child.
sentences.chinese: 他有孩子般的自然举动。

detailed_translations.english: Spontaneity is spontaneous, natural behaviour

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

sentences.english: Is there anything that could protect us from the dangers of stagnation or a double dip?
sentences.chinese: 那么有什么方法能够保护我们免受停滞或二次探底的危险吗？

sentences.english: However, even though unemployment rates will not be as severe, I still predict that we are in store for a miserable decade of economic stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 然而，尽管失业率不会那么高，我仍然认为我们会经历一个悲惨的、经济停滞的十年，现在我们正在为此做准备。

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

sentences.english: The report contains a great deal of statistical information.
sentences.chinese: 该报告包含大量统计资料。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the use of statistics

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: steep
trans: adj. 陡峭的、（上升/下降）急剧的

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: straight
trans: adj/adv. 笔直的/地、直接的/地

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: ultimate
trans: adj. 最终的、根本的、极限的

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: unanimous
trans: adj. 全体同意的、一致通过的

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

sentences.english: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的
detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

sentences.english: Our goal is to unite the opposition parties and defeat the President.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是联合各反对党挫败总统。

detailed_translations.english: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: unsurpassed
trans: adj. 难以超越的、无与伦比的

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

sentences.english: Does your rent include utilities?
sentences.chinese: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 公用事业〔如煤气、电力等〕
detailed_translations.english: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

name: vacuum
trans: v. （用真空吸尘器）清扫、吸入

sentences.english: I vacuumed the carpets today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集； 用真空吸尘器打扫
detailed_translations.english: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: verbal
trans: adj. 口头的、语言的、文字的

sentences.english: verbal skills
sentences.chinese: 语言技能

detailed_translations.chinese: 口头的； 用言辞的， 用文字的； 动词的
detailed_translations.english: spoken rather than written

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

sentences.english: a painting full of vibrant reds and blues
sentences.chinese: 满是鲜亮的红色和蓝色的画作

detailed_translations.chinese: 振动的；充满生气的；响亮的；战栗的
detailed_translations.english: a vibrant colour is bright and strong

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: vigorously
trans: adv. 精力充沛地、强烈地

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

sentences.english: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.chinese: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的、生死攸关的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

sentences.english: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship.
sentences.chinese: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。

sentences.english: He absolutely worships her.
sentences.chinese: 他太崇拜她了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼拜；崇拜；崇拜: 爱慕：崇敬
detailed_translations.english: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god
to admire and love someone very much

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way
